Function Documentation

PUBLIC IMPORT_SHARED t_cm_error CM_CreateMemoryDomain ( const t_cm_domain_memory *  domain,
t_cm_domain_id *  handle 
)

Create a domain.

Create a memory domain for use in the CM for component instantiation and memory allocation.

Parameters:
[in] domain Description of domain memories.
[out] handle Idetifier of the created domain
Exceptions:
CM_INVALID_DOMAIN_DEFINITION 
CM_INTERNAL_DOMAIN_OVERFLOW 
CM_OK 
Returns:
Error code.
PUBLIC IMPORT_SHARED t_cm_error CM_CreateMemoryDomainForClient ( const t_cm_domain_memory *  domain,
t_nmf_client_id  client,
t_cm_domain_id *  handle 
)

Same as CM_CreateMemoryDomain() but on behalf of another process.

Parameters:
See CM_CreateMemoryDomain()
[in] client The process id of the client process
Exceptions:
See CM_CreateMemoryDomain()
Returns:
Error code.
PUBLIC IMPORT_SHARED t_cm_error CM_CreateMemoryDomainScratch ( const t_cm_domain_id  parentId,
const t_cm_domain_memory *  domain,
t_cm_domain_id *  handle 
)

Create a scratch domain.

Create a scratch memory domain. Scratch domains are used to perform overlapping allocations.

Parameters:
[in] parentId Identifier of the (logical) parent domain
[in] domain Description of domain memories.
[out] handle Idetifier of the created domain
Exceptions:
CM_INVALID_DOMAIN_DEFINITION 
CM_INTERNAL_DOMAIN_OVERFLOW 
CM_NO_MORE_MEMORY 
CM_OK 
Returns:
Error code.
PUBLIC IMPORT_SHARED t_cm_error CM_DestroyMemoryDomain ( t_cm_domain_id  handle  ) 

Destroy a memory domain.

Parameters:
[in] handle Domain identifier to destroy.
Exceptions:
CM_INVALID_DOMAIN_HANDLE 
CM_OK 
Returns:
Error code.
PUBLIC IMPORT_SHARED t_cm_error CM_GetDomainCoreId ( const t_cm_domain_id  domainId,
t_nmf_core_id *  coreId 
)

Retrieve the coreId for a given domain. Utility.

Parameters:
[in] domainId Domain identifier.
[out] coreId Core identifier.
Exceptions:
CM_INVALID_DOMAIN_HANDLE Invalid domain handle
CM_OK 
Returns:
Error code.
